title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: was changing u6100 but ripped pad 2 so i ran a line to probe point 850.  now logic board give me green light/ orange light and fan turns on but does not boot.  any ideas?  does not boot with new chip or old chip.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: Why did you replace U6100??? Do you have the original chip????? Check the soldering job, do a continuity test and inspect for missing resistors...

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: had a disgruntled fired employee who returned the store laptop he was using and refused to give us the firmware password.  The original chip is bad on, still same issue.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message:
Can you read the original chip??? if yes, upload the dump to 4shared or something like that, I can help you with that...

But first you need to be sure there is no missing components and the traces are ok....

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: So i just took off the chip and checked all the traces. they are all okay.  No missing components either.  I don't have a reader.  what should i buy to get the dump?

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: You MUST read the original chip! No other way or you will have ME region issues. Get a  programmer and post the dump here.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: Thanks for the help.  What type of device reads the bios chips?  I looked on ebay and couldn't find anything.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: TL866 programmer is good.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message:
Do you know the model of the chip?  would this work?

[url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/TL866CS-USB-Universal-Minipro-Programmer-EEPROM-FLASH-8051-AVR-MCU-GAL-PIC-SPI-/371887595133?hash=item56963a5e7d:g:uS8AAOSwWxNYwUOH[/url]

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: Don't need all those adapters. Simple SOIC8 to DIP is enough. Maybe you need to solder a few wires to the chip.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: For some reason it wont upload, so i put it on my dropbox

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message:
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=0ByfhQ_x0v-tZYUVaZDY3MGpVTEU[/url]

Make sure the "quad enable" bit is still set in the configuration. It should not be affected if you just do a erase/program. It may fail the verify because it will be set in the chip but not in the software. Nothing to worry about. Just make sure if you read the programmed chip that the "quad bit" is still enabled.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: Thanks duke.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a
message: so i programmed the chip, put it back and ran the jump.  i get green/orange light and fan turns on but no chime.  i checked the paths of pins 1-8 and they all work.  any ideas?
